attributes.action: Stop the removal of the stroke unit in the QEQM hospital in Margate
attributes.additional_details: Moving this unit will cost lives of the people around Thanet. The ambulances will have to travel further which will potentially cost lives of the people who are in need of immediate medical care. It costs an ambulance around £155 to run. Moving the unit further away will only increase these figures.
attributes.background: The NHS are moving the stroke unit because of costs although it is costing £40 million to make the move. We feel this is a waste of money.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This would be the responsibility of your local clinical commissioning group.

Under certain circumstances, local authorities can refer a proposed change in local health services to the Secretary of State. We could accept a petition on this subject if that were to happen.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
